sen.j: 六角 義治（ろっかく よしはる）は、南近江国の戦国大名。
sen.e: Yoshiharu ROKKAKU was a daimyo (Japanese territorial lord) in the Sengoku Period, based in Minami Omi Province.
Yoshiharu ROKKAKU was a daimyo (Japanese territorial lord) in the Sengoku Period, based in Minami Omi Province.
Yoshiharu ROKKAKU was a daimyo (Japanese territorial lord) in the Sengoku Period, based in Minami Omi Province.

sen.j: 六角氏の当主。
sen.e: He was the head of the Rokkaku clan.
He was the head of the Rokkaku clan.
He was the head of the Rokkaku clan.

sen.j: 六角 義弼（ろっかく よしすけ）と呼ばれることもある。
sen.e: He was sometimes referred to as Yoshisuke ROKKAKU.
He was sometimes referred to as Yoshisuke ROKKAKU.
He was sometimes referred to as Yoshisuke ROKKAKU.

sen.j: 天文14年（1545年）、六角義賢の嫡男として生まれる。
sen.e: In 1545, he was born as the eldest son and heir of Yoshikata ROKKAKU.
In 1545, Yoshiharu was born the eldest son and heir of Yoshikata ROKKAKU.
In 1545, Yoshiharu was born the eldest son and heir of Yoshikata ROKKAKU.

sen.j: 母は能登国の戦国大名・畠山義総の娘である。
sen.e: His mother was a daughter of Yoshifusa HATAKEYAMA, a daimyo based in Noto Province in the Sengoku Period.
His mother was a daughter of Yoshifusa HATAKEYAMA, a daimyo based in Noto Province in the Sengoku Period.
His mother was a daughter of Yoshifusa HATAKEYAMA, a daimyo based in Noto Province in the Sengoku Period.

sen.j: 義賢ははじめ正室に義総の娘を迎えていたが早世したため、継室にはその妹を迎えていた。
sen.e: Yoshikata's lawful wife, a daughter of Yoshifusa, died young; he then married a younger sister of his late wife as his second wife.
Yoshikata's lawful wife, a daughter of Yoshifusa, died young; he then married the younger sister of his late wife as his second wife.
Yoshikata's lawful wife, a daughter of Yoshifusa, died young; he then married the younger sister of his late wife as his second wife.

sen.j: 義治はその妹を生母とする男児である。
sen.e: Yoshiharu was born as a son of the younger sister.
Yoshiharu was born a son of the younger sister.
Yoshiharu was born a son of the younger sister.

sen.j: ちなみに母親は天文16年（1547年）に早世している。
sen.e: His mother died young in 1547.
His mother died young in 1547.
His mother died young in 1547.

sen.j: 永禄2年（1559年）、父の義賢が隠居したため、家督を継承して当主となった。
sen.e: He succeeded to the family and become the head in 1559, when his father Yoshikata retired.
He succeeded to the family and become the head in 1559, when his father Yoshikata retired.
He succeeded to the family and became the head in 1559, when his father Yoshikata retired.

sen.j: だが実権は父が握っていたらしい。
sen.e: However, it is believed that his father was still at the helm.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, it is believed that his father was still at the helm.
However, it is believed that his father was still at the helm.

sen.j: 永禄4年（1561年）に河内の畠山高政と共闘して三好氏を攻めた際は、父のもとで弟と共に京へ出兵している。
sen.e: He was dispatched to Kyo (Kyoto) under the guidance of his father in 1561, when they united with Takamasa HATAKEYAMA in Kawachi Province to attack the Miyoshi clan.
sen.cmt: 「父のもと」は「父の指導のもと」の意味に解釈して訳しました。一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He was dispatched to Kyo (Kyoto) under the guidance of his father in 1561, when the family united with Takamasa HATAKEYAMA in Kawachi Province to attack the Miyoshi clan.
He was dispatched to Kyo (Kyoto) under the guidance of his father in 1561, when the family united with Takamasa HATAKEYAMA in Kawachi Province to attack the Miyoshi clan.

sen.j: 永禄6年（1563年）、六角家中でも特に信望のあった重臣後藤賢豊親子を観音寺城内で誅殺してしまう（観音寺騒動）。
sen.e: In 1563, Katatoyo GOTO, senior vassal who was winning particularly good reputation within the Rokkaku clan, was killed with his son at Kannon-ji Temple (Kannonji family feud).
In 1563, Katatoyo GOTO, a senior vassal who was winning a particularly good reputation within the Rokkaku clan, was killed with his son at Kannon-ji Temple (Kannonji family feud).
In 1563, Katatoyo GOTO, a senior vassal who was winning a particularly good reputation within the Rokkaku clan, was killed with his son at Kannon-ji Temple (Kannonji family feud).

sen.j: これを契機として六角氏の家中は動揺し、近隣の浅井長政に主替えする者まで現れ始めた。
sen.e: The incident destabilized the Rokkaku clan; some retainers left to serve the neighbor, Nagamasa AZAI.
The incident destabilized the Rokkaku clan; some retainers left to serve a neighbor, Nagamasa AZAI.
The incident destabilized the Rokkaku clan; some retainers left to serve a neighbor, Nagamasa AZAI.

sen.j: この騒動で義治は一時、父と共に反発した家臣団に観音寺城を追われた。
sen.e: As a result of the feud, Yoshiharu and his father were expelled Kannonji-jo Castle by their rebel retainer forces.
As a result of the feud, Yoshiharu and his father were expelled from Kannonji-jo Castle by their rebel retainer forces.
As a result of the feud, Yoshiharu and his father were expelled from Kannonji-jo Castle by their rebel retainer forces.

sen.j: 重臣の蒲生定秀、蒲生賢秀らの尽力により観音寺城に戻った。
sen.e: The vessels, Sadahide GAMO and Katahide GAMO, exerted themselves to have them returned to Kannonji-jo Castle.
Two vassels, Sadahide GAMO and Katahide GAMO, exerted themselves to have them returned to Kannonji-jo Castle.
Two vassels, Sadahide GAMO and Katahide GAMO, exerted themselves to have them returned to Kannonji-jo Castle.

sen.j: 永禄8年（1565年）、京で三好三人衆と松永久秀が将軍・足利義輝を殺害する。
sen.e: In 1565, miyoshi sanninshu (three chief retainers of the Miyoshi clan) and Hisahide MATSUNAGA killed Shogun Yoshiteru ASHIKAGA in Kyo (Kyoto).
In 1565, miyoshi sanninshu (three chief retainers of the Miyoshi clan) and Hisahide MATSUNAGA killed Shogun Yoshiteru ASHIKAGA in Kyo (Kyoto).
In 1565, miyoshi sanninshu (three chief retainers of the Miyoshi clan) and Hisahide MATSUNAGA killed Shogun Yoshiteru ASHIKAGA in Kyo (Kyoto).

sen.j: 義治は義輝の弟・足利義昭が亡命してくるとそれを匿った。
sen.e: Yoshiharu sheltered Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA, the younger brother of Yoshiteru, who was in exile.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Yoshiharu sheltered Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA, the younger brother of Yoshiteru, who was in exile.
Yoshiharu sheltered Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA, the younger brother of Yoshiteru, who was in exile.

sen.j: 三好三人衆が管領職などを条件にして義治を誘ってくると、義治はこれに応じて義昭を追放した。
sen.e: Miyoshi sanninshu approached Yoshiharu and offered a post of kanrei (shogunal deputy) as a bargaining point; Yoshiharu expelled Yoshiaki in response.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Miyoshi sanninshu approached Yoshiharu and offered the post of kanrei (shogunal deputy) as a bargaining chip; in response, Yoshiharu expelled Yoshiaki.
Miyoshi sanninshu approached Yoshiharu and offered the post of kanrei (shogunal deputy) as a bargaining chip; in response, Yoshiharu expelled Yoshiaki.

sen.j: 永禄10年（1567年）4月28日、主君の権限を抑える分国法である六角氏式目に署名することを余儀なくされた。
sen.e: On April 28, 1567, he had no other choice but signed on Rokkakushi shikimoku (bunkokuho by Rokkaku clan), which was a bunkokuho (the law individual sengoku-daimyo enforced in their own domain); the purpose of the law was to suppress each load's authority.

On April 28, 1567, he had no other choice but to sign the Rokkakushi shikimoku (bunkokuho by Rokkaku clan), which was a bunkokuho (the law individual sengoku-daimyo enforced in their own domain); the purpose of the law was to suppress each lord's authority.

On June 15, 1567, he had no other choice but to sign the Rokkakushi shikimoku (bunkokuho by Rokkaku clan), which was a bunkokuho (the law individual sengoku-daimyo enforced in their own domain); the purpose of the law was to suppress each lord's authority.

sen.j: 家督も強制的に弟の六角義定に譲らされたとされるのが従来の通説であるがこれには異説もある。
sen.e: It is generally believed that he was forced to transfer responsibility for the family to his younger brother, Yoshisada ROKKAKU; however, there are different thoughts on this issue.
It is generally believed that he was forced to transfer responsibility for the family to his younger brother, Yoshisada ROKKAKU; however, there are different thoughts on this issue.
It is generally believed that he was forced to transfer responsibility for the family to his younger brother, Yoshisada ROKKAKU; however, there are different thoughts on this issue.

sen.j: 永禄11年（1568年）、織田信長が侵攻して来ると、仇敵であった三好氏の勢力と対信長で共闘することになる。
sen.e: He united with his former enemy, the Mitoshi clan forces, to fight against Nobunaga ODA upon Nobunaga's invasion in 1568.
He united with his former enemy, the Mitoshi clan forces, to fight against Nobunaga ODA upon Nobunaga's invasion in 1568.
He united with his former enemy, the Mitoshi clan forces, to fight against Nobunaga ODA upon Nobunaga's invasion in 1568.

sen.j: 三好三人衆の岩成友通らの援助を受けて徹底抗戦を図り、一旦は追い返した。
sen.e: Supported by Tomomichi IWANARI, a member of miyoshi sanninshu, he demonstrated do-or-die resistance and initially sent Nobunaga away.
sen.cmt: 「一旦は追い返した」は「一旦は信長を追い返した」の意味に解釈して訳しました。一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Supported by Tomomichi IWANARI, a member of miyoshi sanninshu, he demonstrated do-or-die resistance and initially sent Nobunaga away.
Supported by Tomomichi IWANARI, a member of miyoshi sanninshu, he demonstrated do-or-die resistance and initially sent Nobunaga away.

sen.j: しかし、信長は翌年六角方の抗戦体制が緩んだ機に再侵攻して来た。
sen.e: However, Nobunaga reinvaded in the following year, when the Rokkaku's resistance came loose.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, Nobunaga reinvaded in the following year, when the Rokkaku's resistance came loose.
However, Nobunaga reinvaded in the following year, when the Rokkaku's resistance came loose.

sen.j: 激戦の末に六角親子の立て篭もる箕作城は落城。
sen.e: After a fierce battle, Mitsukuri-jo Castle, which the Rokkakus cloistered themselves, surrendered.
After a fierce battle, Mitsukuri-jo Castle, where the Rokkakus cloistered themselves, surrendered.
After a fierce battle, Mitsukuri-jo Castle, where the Rokkakus cloistered themselves, surrendered.

sen.j: 六角勢は甲賀郡に拠点を移す。
sen.e: The Rokkaku forces relocated their foothold to Koga County.
The Rokkaku forces relocated their foothold to Koga County.
The Rokkaku forces relocated their foothold to Koga County.

sen.j: その後も浅井氏・朝倉氏と連携するなどして信長方を苦しめ続ける。
sen.e: He continued to vex the Nobunaga's side by forming alliance with the Azai clan and Asakura clan.
He continued to vex the Nobunaga's side by forming an alliance with the Azai clan and the Asakura clan.
He continued to vex the Nobunaga's side by forming an alliance with the Azai clan and the Asakura clan.

sen.j: 信長の要請による朝廷の介入により、信長と六角・浅井・朝倉は和議を結ぶ。
sen.e: The Imperial court mediated a settlement between Nobunaga and ROKKAKU, AZAI and ASAKURA, upon Nobunaga's request.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: At Nobunaga's request, the Imperial court mediated a settlement between Nobunaga and ROKKAKU, AZAI, and ASAKURA.
At Nobunaga's request, the Imperial court mediated a settlement between Nobunaga and Rokkaku, Azai, and Asakura.
sen.cmt: すべて大文字の箇所を修正

sen.j: しかし、体勢を立て直した信長は和議を一方的に破棄し、朝倉、次いで浅井を滅ぼすに至り、義治は信長と再度和睦する。
sen.e: However, Nobunaga, who rebuilt his forces, unilaterally broke the settlement and ruined ASAKURA and AZAI; Yoshiharu once again reconciled with Nobunaga.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, Nobunaga, who rebuilt his forces, unilaterally broke the settlement and ruined ASAKURA and AZAI; Yoshiharu once again reconciled with Nobunaga.
However, Nobunaga, who rebuilt his forces, unilaterally broke the settlement and ruined Asakura and Azai; Yoshiharu once again reconciled with Nobunaga.
sen.cmt: すべて大文字の箇所を修正

sen.j: その後も甲賀郡を拠点に、足利将軍家・越後上杉・甲斐武田らを動員した信長包囲網の構築を御膳立てする。
sen.e: With his foothold in Koga County, he arranged Siege around Nobunaga by mobilizing Ashikaga Shogunate house, UESUGI in Echigo Province and TAKEDA in Kai Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: With his foothold in Koga County, he arranged Siege around Nobunaga by mobilizing Ashikaga Shogunate houses, UESUGI in Echigo Province and TAKEDA in Kai Province.
With his foothold in Koga County, he arranged Siege around Nobunaga by mobilizing Ashikaga Shogunate houses, Uesugi in Echigo Province and Takeda in Kai Province.
sen.cmt: すべて大文字の箇所を修正

sen.j: このように、義賢・義治父子の反信長の戦いは続いたが、次第に史料からは姿を消していく。
sen.e: Yoshiharu and his father Yoshikata continued to fight against Nobunaga; however, they gradually disappear from historical records.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Yoshiharu and his father Yoshikata continued to fight against Nobunaga; however, they gradually disappear from historical records.
Yoshiharu and his father Yoshikata continued to fight against Nobunaga; however, they gradually disappear from historical records.

sen.j: 信長の死後、豊臣氏の時代が訪れた。
sen.e: After Nobunaga's death, the Toyotomi clan took over power.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After Nobunaga's death, the Toyotomi clan took power.
After Nobunaga's death, the Toyotomi clan took power.

sen.j: 関白・豊臣秀次主催の犬追物に弓馬指南役として出席しているのが確認される。
sen.e: He was witnessed at an inuoumono (dog-hunting event, a skill of an archery) hosted by Kanpaku (regent) Hidetsugu TOYOTOMI, where he served as a kyuba shinanyaku (trainer for an archery and a horsemanship).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He was witnessed at an inuoumono (dog-hunting event, a skill of an archery) hosted by Kanpaku (regent) Hidetsugu TOYOTOMI, where he served as a kyuba shinanyaku (trainer for archery and horsemanship).

He was witnessed at an inuoumono (dog-hunting event, a skill of an archery) hosted by Kanpaku (regent) Hidetsugu TOYOTOMI, where he served as a kyuba shinanyaku (trainer for archery and horsemanship).

sen.j: 豊臣秀吉の御伽衆として仕えたとされる。
sen.e: He is believed to have served Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI as an otogishu (adviser).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He is believed to have served Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI as an otogishu (adviser).
He is believed to have served Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI as an otogishu (adviser).

sen.j: 秀吉の死後は豊臣秀頼の弓矢の師範を務めた。
sen.e: He served Hideyori TOYOTOMI as a master of bow and arrow after Hideyoshi's death.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He served Hideyori TOYOTOMI as a master of bow and arrow after Hideyoshi's death.
He served Hideyori TOYOTOMI as a master of bow and arrow after Hideyoshi's death.

sen.j: 出家していたらしい。
sen.e: It is believed that he had become a priest.
It is believed that he had become a priest.
It is believed that he had become a priest.

sen.j: 慶長17年（1612年）10月22日に死去。
sen.e: He died on October 22, 1612.
He died on October 22, 1612.
He died on November 14, 1612.

sen.j: 享年68。
sen.e: Died at age 68.
Died at age 68.
Died at age 68.

sen.j: 位牌は父・承禎（義賢）と共に、京都宇治一休寺にある。
sen.e: Ihai (ancestral tablets) of his father Jotei (Yoshitaka) and Yoshiharu himself were placed at Ikkyu-ji Temple in Uji, Kyoto.
Ihai (ancestral tablets) of his father Jotei (Yoshitaka) and Yoshiharu himself were placed at Ikkyu-ji Temple in Uji, Kyoto.
Ihai (ancestral tablets) of his father Jotei (Yoshitaka) and Yoshiharu himself were placed at Ikkyu-ji Temple in Uji, Kyoto.
